reviewText:
It doesn't take a significant amount of time to realize just what kind of narrative The Deer is trying to establish.

The Deer, taken at surface value, is an educational game oriented towards young children, going over the evolution of the deer as we know it, but it's far more than what it claims to be.

At it's core, The Deer is a gripping experience that asks the age old question of human existance and what it truly means to be alive. It is executed perfectly, never once taking control away from the player- an important detail that greatly aids us in understanding the central idea behind the game.

The game is thoroughly nihilistic in it's thoughts, questioning much (if not all!) of what we, as a species, consider important.

I'll be spoiling the majority of the game, so if you wish to have a blind playthrough, don't read following section. It's currently on sale (Dec 4-10) for only 11 cents, and it's an absolute must have. Even without the sale it's only 19 cents, so you really don't have a reason to miss out on this gem. I highly recommend this game to anyone that's looking for a game with purpose and meaning.

EDIT: Price has been raised, still worth it.

reviewText:
An educational game where you play as a Deer and learn about it's habitat and things that surround it sounds like a fun game. When I first heard of this I thought we get to play through the life of a Deer and learn things along the way... that'll be an interested concept. However I was fastly disappointed and heres why.

Pros:
♦ Game is playable and works (Doesn't crash or have bugs)
♦ Graphics seem decent (For what it is, they are decent)
♦ Has Steam Trading Cards (It's good that is has them, but see my cons on this as well)

Cons:
♦ Expensive for the time you get out of it (It took me 4minutes to read and do everything, 4 minutes for a dollar...)
♦ Way too short (Took 4mins to complete the whole game)
♦ Information was weird (Some was interesting and others was just like why would an educational game say that?)
♦ Minigames were pointless (There was only 3 and each one had no timer, no score... essentially had no aspects to make them even worth playing or replaying)
♦ No replayability (Once you play it once, there is no reason to go back)
♦ Not enough content to unlock Trading Cards (As I said it's good to have them, but as cards take 2hours to drop and this game takes 4minutes to play, why have them?)
♦ No Achievements (There could easily have been achievements)
♦ No point purchasing the game (I say this because the gameplay advertisement video on the store page literally shows the whole game... why buy something when you can see it unlimited times for free?)
♦ Isn't really an educational game about Deer (Don't get to play through the life of a Deer, only really gives random facts about random animals, objects and things around him)
♦ Concept of Water in this game is misleading for Children (I say this as the Deer walks under water and puts on a scuba diving helmet and can breathe. For an educational game, that is far from being very educational as this is not what actually happens and by doing this it could teach kids that if they throw a deer into a lake, it'll be able to breathe which isn't the case).
♦ Poorly executed game (Game has potential to be massive and highly educational, except it's short, has minimal educational facts and little to no fun gameplay)

Overall, I think the game creators knew there wasn't enough content in the game and hence made Steam Trading Cards to make it look like people were playing their game for at least over 2 hours which probably looks good for it's $1 price. Also as the whole game took me 4mins to complete and the fact you can watch the whole game for free on their Steam Page via their advertisement gameplay video... I wouldn't recommend wasting $1 on this game as you'll be highly disappointed like I was.

PS: To review I had to play for 1 more minute as I needed 5mins to review not 4.

reviewText:
You don’t get to play one of the worst games ever made that often. This is one such game. The Deer is an educational game for children that aspires to teach players about the Ice Age. The focus is on the deer and its immediate surroundings. Like the mouse. And an oak tree. The game can be completed in less than 5 minutes. Using an abysmal control scheme, you guide the deer from the left to the right. There’s the aforementioned mouse, oak tree, a squirrel and a rhino. After about 5 meters, you come to a lake. Not a problem because deer don’t swim, they simply walk along the bottom of the lake. After about 4 meters of underwater walking, there’s nowhere else to go. Along those 9 meters of gameplay, you can click on three points of interest to play three mini-games. One is a memory game, the other is about recognizing deer food (deer don’t eat fries from McDonald’s – shock!), and I don’t even know what the hell was the third one about anymore.

I didn’t learn crap from this game. But the worst offending thing is the horrible grammar, especially considering that this is supposed to be an educational game. “Between the companions of The Deer, there were even the lazy dormouses.” “Did you know that the majestic oaks can live even 1000 years?” “Near the lake, lived even many frogs and toads.” Unless you want your kids to learn broken English, stay away. Absolute bullcrap. Apart from the illustrations, which are nice and which drew me to the game along with the premise, the only good thing was that I bought the game during launch for 11 cents (the developer has since increased the price to 99 cents). It has trading cards, so I actually made a profit.

1 OUT OF 10 (TERRIBLE)

reviewText:
Getting this game for free from the publisher's site took longer than playing this game. I wouldn't bother writing this review (that took more time than playing the game) if the publisher didn't ask nice.
First of all the art is beutiful, no doubts about that. But I didn't come to look at pictures I came to play and the UX was very underwhelming (I'm also a Unity game dev myself):
* First of all using the free edition of Unity seems very unprofessional but considering the scale of the game I'll give it a pass.
* The walking mechanic which is just walking left or right with A and D (with no other input option like the arrow keys) and even simple thing like that doesn't work and you can't turn for some reason if you changed the direction once. WTF?! I don't know how they screwed something that simple.
* It's just walking to either direction until you hit a wall, on the right side you walk underwater but this game supposed to be educational so why the heck that dear can breath under water?!
* The memory game is broken, instead of giving feedback if you chose the two coresponding items (every two items of course) they just disappear after 4 seconds. This is not how it should work, how did you screw it up?
* All mini-games don't end when they're finished. You need to exit yourself manually. Why? Also the mini game don't tell you when it's finished.
* It takes about 5 minutes top to finish this game including reading about the era when that deer was alive.
* On the plus side it has steam trading cards hence my more than 5 minutes gameplay. But it seems that it is either a lie, mistake or another mis-implementation since no badge are actually available.

I can't recommend this because paying for less than 5 minutes unchallenging game when basic simple stuff isn't implemented right seems unjust.

Did you know that majestic oaks can live even 1000 years?
